On Wednesday, November 27, 2013 12:33:54 AM UTC-8, Brad Verity wrote:

> My next post will cover all of the remaining Edward III descents, including those from James I and James II of Scotland, within the paternal Byron ancestry of the 11th Baron Byron.

The 11th Baron's father was Col. Wilfrid Byron of South Perth, Western Australia. He was born 31 January 1871 at Stoke Talmage, Oxfordshire, and died 7 November 1936 at Hardy Street, South Perth, buried 9 November 1936 at Karrakatta Cemetery, Perth. There is a portrait of Col. Wilfrid (as leader of the 3rd/1st Leicestershire Yeomanry, here (scroll down a bit):

http://www.paoyeomanry.co.uk/PM/LY3rd1stWW1.htm

Col. Wilfrid married 25 September 1901 at St Michael & All Angels Church, Appleby Magna, Leicestershire, Sylvia Mary Moore (born 18 October 1880 at Appleby Hall, Leicestershire; died 27 December 1952, Hampshire). Sylvia was the daughter of Wilfrid's first cousin, Mabel Charlotte Byron (born 20 April 1853 at Bryanstone Square, Westminster; died 19 December 1926 at Lavender Cottage, Appleby Magna).

Below are the 50 separate lines of descent from Edward III (excluding some from James IV, which have already been posted) for Col. Wilfrid Byron & for his first cousin Mabel Byron Moore. As usual, links to individuals in Leo's database are included for each line.

Edward III had 4 sons, A1, OO1, QQ1 & TT1 (see below)

A1) John of Gaunt, 1st Duke of Lancaster (1340-1399) m. three times, and had 2 daus A2 & AA2, and 2 sons BB2 & CC2 (see below)

A2) Joan Beaufort, by 3rd wife (c.1377-1440) m. twice, and had 2 sons A3 & P3, and 5 daus Q3, S3, T3, U3 & W3 (see below)

A3) Richard Neville, Earl of Salisbury, by 2nd husband (c.1398-1460) m. Alice Montagu

(1406-1462, descended from Edward I), and had 3 daus A4, F4, & H4, and a son L4 (see below)

A4) Alice Neville (c.1434-aft.1503) m. Henry Fitzhugh, 6th Lord Fitzhugh (1429-1472), and had

A5) Elizabeth Fitzhugh (1462-bef.1407) m. twice, and had two daus A6 & D6, and a son C6 (see below)

A6) Alice Vaux, by 2nd husband (b. c.1487) m. Sir Richard Sapcote of Elton Hall (1483-1543), and had

A7) Anne Sapcote (c.1508-1576) m. Sir William Fitzwilliam of Milton (1503-1552), and had

A8) Sir William Fitzwilliam of Gains Park (1526-1599) m. Anne Sidney (c.1525-1602, descended from Edward I), and had

A9) Margaret Fitzwilliam (1559-1623) m. Sir John Byron of Newstead Priory (c.1560-1623), and had

A10) Sir John Byron of Newstead Priory (c.1581-1625) m. Anne Molyneux (c.1580-aft.1629, descended from Edward I), and had

A11) Richard, 2nd Baron Byron of Rochdale (1606-1679) m. 1) Elizabeth Rossell (d. 1657), and had

A12) William, 3rd Baron Byron of Rochdale (1635-1695) m. 1) Elizabeth Chaworth (c.1637-1683, descended from Edward I), and had

A13) William, 4th Baron Byron of Rochdale (1670-1736) m. 3) Hon. Frances Berkeley (c.1702-1757, descended from Edward I)*, and had

A14) Hon. John Byron of Twickenham (1723-1786) m. Sophia Trevanion (see I14 below), and had

A15) Capt. George Anson Byron (1758-1793) m. Henrietta Charlotte Dallas (1762-1793), and had

A16) George, 7th Baron Byron of Rochdale (1789-1868) m. Elizabeth Mary Chandos-Pole (see C17 below), and had 2 sons A17 & B17 (see below)

A17) Hon. Rev. William Byron of Stowlangtoft (1831-1907) m. 1) Mary Elizabeth Kindersley (1834-1877, descended from Edward I)**, and had

A18) Col. Wilfrid Byron of South Perth, Western Australia (1871-1936) m. Sylvia Mary Moore (see B19 below)

http://www.genealogics.org/getperson.php?personID=I00306994&tree=LEO

*I'm one of those who feel there is not enough evidence to support Joan Stradling, the 1st wife of Maurice Dennys of Siston, being a daughter of Jane Beaufort, daughter of Cardinal Henry Beaufort. But for those who feel that connection is valid, then Hon. Frances Berkeley would be a descendant of Edward III thru Cardinal Beaufort.

**Mary Elizabeth Kindersley is a descendant of Sir Thomas Leigh of Addington (1639-1677) and his wife "Hannah, d. and coheir of Anthony Rolfe, of Tuttington, near Aylsham, Co. Norf., gent. (grandson of John Rolfe by Rebecca his wife, d. of Pocahontas, Emperor of Powhattan)":

https://archive.org/stream/noticesoffamilyo00gowe#page/n109/mode/2up

So wrote Victorian-era genealogist Granville Leveson-Gower, in his 1878 book 'Notices of the Family of Leigh of Addington'. Basically, Leveson Gower claimed that Anthony Rolfe of Tuttington was a grandson of Pocahontas and her English husband John Rolfe. This was a strong belief amongst the descendants of Sir Thomas Leigh and Hannah Rolfe, to the point where there is a plaque in St Mary Church, Gravesend, Kent (where Pocahontas is buried) laying out the descent from the Native American princess, thru Hannah Rolfe and Sir Thomas Leigh, down to Edwina Ashley, countess Mountbatten of Burma. A few years after publication, other genealogists pointed out the chronological difficulties in making Anthony Rolfe (born 1600) into a grandson of Pocahontas (c.1595-1617), but the Leigh of Addington descendants were having none of it - they refused to give up the long-standing family tradition of their descent from her:

http://books.google.ca/books?id=5YEDAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA391&lpg=PA391&dq=anthony+rolfe+of+tuttington&source=bl&ots=4v1qPLSP6h&sig=M5n0gHxfsOwVlgqz89ZfuoDljiE&hl=en&sa=X&ei=VZKWUpG-Acf9oATM7IEw&ved=0CEkQ6AEwCA#v=onepage&q=anthony%20rolfe%20of%20tuttington&f=false

I love the irony of British landed gentry refusing to concede the impossibility of their descent from a famous Native American princess, when at the same time across the Pond, many Americans refused to give up belief in their descent from medieval royals, even in the face of evidence that definitively disproved alleged royal lines. The late, much missed genealogist William Addams Reitwiesner very ably debunks the Pocahontas/Hannah Rolfe descent in a 1999 post:

https://groups.google.com/d/msg/alt.talk.royalty/-Tcf9cnpRlQ/dVeScd8VeHgJ

The Leighs of Addington do, however, have undisputed descents from Edward I.

On Friday, November 29, 2013 11:33:48 AM UTC-8, Brad Verity wrote:

> My final post to complete the 11th Baron Byron's royal lines, will be all of the remaining Edward III descents for Rev. Charles Moore.

Rev. Charles Moore has more than double the lines of Descent from Edward III than his wife Mabel Byron. Since there are so many lines I've split them up into two posts. This first post will include all of Rev. Moore's descents from Edward III's grandson John Beaufort, 1st Earl of Somerset, and the final post will be all of the remaining Edward III descents.

Rev. Moore's lines of descent from Henry VII of England, James IV of Scotland, and Henry IV of England have already been posted, those are not included here. Nor is the Rev. Moore's lines of descent from Edward III thru his ancestor Hon. Elizabeth Tracy. Rev. Moore is a descendant of Elizabeth through her second marriage. As Rev. Moore's wife Mabel Byron is also a descendant of Hon. Elizabeth Tracy, through her first marriage, all of Elizabeth's lines of descent from Edward III have already been posted previously in this thread, and won't be repeated here.

What is presented are 92 separate lines of descent from Edward III, as follows, with links to the most recent individual in Leo's database, for each line.
